intro: Phtheirospermum glandulosum, commonly known as the sticky phtheirospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in arid regions.
